item.title: Report X-2024081684
item.description:
Report X-2024081684

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 4X16 LITERS (GLASS BOTTLES) SIGMA-ALDRICH METHANOL THE 4 BOTTLES WERE CRACKED AND CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 100% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL

item.title: Report E-2024080646
item.description:
Report E-2024080646

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-15
  • City: BURLINGTON TOWNSHIP
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 15, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN3266 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the box packaging and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted site. MEG personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the UN3266-impacted cardboard box and pallet. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080637
item.description:
Report E-2024080637

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: BURLINGTON TOWNSHIP
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 14, 2024, one (1) 35-gallon drum of UN3266 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN3266-impacted trailer floor. The damaged drum and all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024081749

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-24
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package arrived at hazmat cage during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. Inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, torn open, and 1 of 4 items had a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being placed on the wrong conveyor belt. Remaining content will be returned to shipper.

item.title: Report I-2024080082
item.description:
Report I-2024080082

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: West Deptford
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/17/2024 this shipment was discovered during the shipment inspection process to contain hidden dangerous goods at the DHL NJS Service Center, 1240 Forest Parkway, Suite 400, West Deptford, NJ 08066. Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment UN1950 Aerosols, flammable Class 9 Class 2.1 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Packaging Type: Receptacle Material of Construction: Plastic Material of Construction: Metal Package Capacity: 249 g Package Capacity: 382 g Amount in Package: 249 g Amount in Package: 382 g Number in Shipment: 4 Number in Shipment: 1 Number Failed: 4 Number Failed: 1
